The following is a representative barcode sequence, the centroid of all available sequences for this species.


There is 1 barcode sequence available from BOLD and GenBank.

Below is the sequence of the barcode region Cytochrome oxidase subunit 1 (COI or COX1) from a member of the species.

See the BOLD taxonomy browser for more complete information about this specimen.

Other sequences that do not yet meet barcode criteria may also be available.

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: De Grave, S., Klotz, W. & Cai, X. 2013. Caridina cantonensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2013

Assessor/s
De Grave, S., Klotz, W. & Cai, X.

Reviewer/s
Cumberlidge, N. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is known from Guangdong and Guangxi Provinces (China), Hong Kong and probably northern Vietnam (Liang 2004), where it inhabits mountain streams and rivulets. Although the species is infrequently available in the aquarium trade, in low numbers, this is not thought to pose a threat to the species. In view of its relatively wide distribution and the absence of any known, major threats it is considered as Least Concern.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Golden bee shrimp
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Golden bee shrimp." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 11 Mar 2013, 01:04 UTC. 19 Jan 2015 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Golden_bee_shrimp&oldid=642908295>.
dataObjects.description:
The golden bee shrimp is a species of shrimp found in southern China, including Hong Kong .[1] It is one of many varieties of Bee shrimp.

Appearance[edit]

The shrimp has a white outside shell and the flesh is an orange/golden color. Females are larger than males and the female's eggs are brown. The offspring are the same color as their parents when they emerge from the eggs .[2]

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b Rita S. W. Yam & David Dudgeon (2005). "Genetic differentiation of Caridina cantonensis (Decapoda:Atyidae) in Hong Kong streams". Journal of the North American Benthological Society 24 (4): 845–857. doi:10.1899/05-022.1. 
  2. ^ Aquatic Community


This Decapoda article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

dataObjects.description: German: 1=Bienengarnele mit Gelege English: Crystal red shrimp with eggs

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-blue-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis blue tiger is an easy to keep freshwater shrimp with blue color and orange eyes.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis blue tiger ist eine leicht zu pflegende Garnele für das Süßwasseraquarium in blauer Farbe mit orangen Augen.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-deep-blue-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis deep blue tiger is a freshwater shrimp with a deep blue color and orange eyes.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis deep blue tiger is eine Garnele für das Süßwasseraquarium mit tief blauer Färbung und orangen Augen.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-black-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis black tiger is a freshwatershrimp with black color. It seems to be a selected breed of mutated tigershrimp, maybe from the blue tigers.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis black tiger ist eine Garnelen für das Süßwasseraquarium mit schwarzer Färbung. Es wird vermutlich eine Hochzuchtform der Tiger- bzw. der blauen Tigergarnelen sein.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-red-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis red tiger is a transparent shrimp with red tiger stripes. This shrimp is also able for keeping in freshwater tank.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis red tiger ist eine transparente Süßwassergarnele mit roten Tigerstreifen.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-orange-eye-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis orange eye tiger is an easy to breed freshwater shrimp. This shrimp ist transparent with dark stripes. On the picture you see a female one with orange eggs.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis orange eye tiger ist eine einfach zu züchtende Süßwassergarnele. Sie ist transparent mit dunklen Streifen. Auf dem Bild ist ein Weibchen mit orange farbenen Eiern zusehen.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-tiger.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis tiger is a freshwater shrimp. It is transparent with black stripes.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis tiger ist eine Süßwassergarnele die transparent mit schwarzen Streifen daher kommt.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-crystal-red.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis crystal red is a very popular shrimp. It is a mutation from the bee shrimp Caridina cf. cantonensis where the black pigments are missing  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis crystal red ist eine sehr beliebte Süßwassergarnele. Es handelt sich um eine Mutation der Bienengarnele bei der die schwarzen Farbpigmente fehlen.

dataObjects.title: File:Caridina-cf-cantonensis-black-bee.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis black bee is a freshwatershrimp colored black and white looking like a bee.  German: 1=Caridina cf. cantonensis black bee ist eine Süßwassergarnele die schwarz-weiß gefärbt wie eine Biene aussieht.
